place.name: ULCEBY BY ALFORD
place.gazetteerText: ULCEBY, a parish in Spilsby district, Lincoln; 2½ miles SW of Alford r. station. Post town, Alford. Acres, 2,220. Real property, £1,622. Pop., 212. Houses, 38. The manor belongs to Capt. Mansell. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £650.* Patron, the Rev. W. A. Peacock. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
